V kratkem razpis za glavna dela pri projektu drugega tira
07 Nov 2019, 15:29 by STA

Družba 2TDK, ki je zadolžena za razvoj drugega železniškega tira med Divačo in Koprom, bo javni naročili za glavna gradbena dela objavila ta mesec. Kot so pojasnili v družbi, je dokumentacija pripravljena in čaka na potrditev infrastrukturnega ministrstva ter nadzornikov 2TDK. Medtem pa še vedno ni rešen zaplet z razpisom za Glinščico.



Gradnja drugega tira Foto: Zdravko Primožič/FPA

LJUBLJANA > Razpis za glavna dela bo 2TDK razdelil na dva dela, in sicer od Divače do Črnega Kala in od Črnega Kala do Kopra. Prvo javno naročilo predvideva gradnjo dveh predorov s servisnimi cevmi in pripadajočo predorsko opremo, drugo pa gradnjo preostalih šestih predorov in dveh viaduktov, zemeljskih del ter drugih objektov na trasi drugega tira.
Medtem ko se v podjetju pripravljajo na objavo javnih naročil za glavna dela, pa na epilog še čaka prvo večje naročilo v okviru projekta, in sicer naročilo za objekte za prečkanje reke Glinščice. Tega je 2TDK objavil marca letos, nato pa ga je zaradi suma ponarejene reference izbranega ponudnika avgusta razveljavil.
Sporna je bila višina zidu v Pesnici, ki jo je kot referenco v razpisu za prečkanje Glinščice navedel konzorcij podjetij Markomark Nival. Ta se je zaradi razveljavljenega razpisa pritožili na Državno revizijsko komisijo, ki pa je v postopku ugotovila, da na podlagi pridobljenih gradiv še ne more ustrezno ugotoviti dejanskega stanja v zadevi. Zato je strokovnjakoma mariborske fakultete za gradbeništvo naročila izdelavo strokovnega mnenja.
Tudi tu se je zapletlo, saj je podjetje 2TDK zahtevalo izločitev obeh strokovnjakov, ki ju je revizijska komisija aktivirala za merjenje zidu v Pesnici. V zahtevku za izločitev se je sklicevalo na anonimno sporočilo, ki so ga prejeli v družbi, in katerega vsebina se je nanašala na domnevno nepristranskost imenovanih strokovnjakov.
Državna revizijska komisija je zahtevo 2TDK zavrnila. Kot je ugotovila, namreč v zahtevi za izločitev strokovnjakov ni navedel okoliščin, ki bi vzbudile dvom v njuno nepristranskost.

Short call for main works on the second track project
07 Nov 2019, 15:29 by STA

2TDK, which is in charge of developing a second railway line between Divača and Koper, will announce public contracts for major construction works this month. As the company explained, the documentation is ready and awaiting approval from the Infrastructure Ministry and 2TDK supervisors. Meanwhile, the problem with the tender for Glinščica has still not been solved.



Construction of the second track Photo: Zdravko Primožič / FPA

LJUBLJANA> The tender for the main works will split the 2TDK into two parts, namely from Divača to Crna Kal and from Crna Kal to Koper. The first contract foresees the construction of two tunnels with service tubes and associated tunnel equipment, while the second involves the construction of the remaining six tunnels and two viaducts, earthworks and other structures on the other track.
While the company is preparing to launch public contracts for major works, the first major contract within the project is still pending for the epilogue, namely the contract for the Glinščica River crossing facilities. This was published by the 2TDK in March of this year and then overturned in August due to suspected forgery of the successful bidder.
The height of the wall in Pesnica has been controversial, cited by the Markomark Nival consortium of companies as a reference in the Glinščica crossing invitation. The latter appealed to the State Audit Commission because of the canceled call, which in the process found that it could not yet adequately determine the actual situation in the case on the basis of the material obtained. Therefore, she commissioned the experts of the Faculty of Civil Engineering of Maribor to produce an expert opinion.
This was complicated too, as 2TDK requested the removal of both experts, who had been activated by the audit committee to measure the wall in Pesnica. The request for exclusion referred to an anonymous message received from the company, the content of which concerned the alleged impartiality of the appointed experts.
The State Review Commission rejected the request of 2TDK. In her request for exclusion of experts, she did not state any circumstances which would cast doubt on their impartiality.
